ingredients.name: Soda water (If you can, use grapefruit soda water)

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Start by preparing a glass (ideally a highball glass) by running a lime wedge around the rim and dipping it into a small plate of salt to coat the edge

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Fill the glass with ice cubes

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Pour in the tequila, followed by the grapefruit juice and lime juice

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Add a pinch of salt to the mixture

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Gently top off the drink with soda water, preferably grapefruit soda water for an extra citrusy kick

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Stir the drink gently to mix all the ingredients

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: Garnish with a slice of grapefruit or a lime wedge, and enjoy your refreshing Paloma!

steps.name: Step: 8
steps.text: Smoked Salt Rim: Elevate the traditional salt rim by using smoked salt. The smoky flavor adds a subtle depth that beautifully complements the earthy notes of the tequila while contrasting with the bright grapefruit and lime. For an even more elevated experience, try a mix of smoked salt and Tajín for a slight chili kick.

steps.name: Step: 9
steps.text: Fresh Grapefruit Peel Zest: Before juicing your grapefruit, zest a bit of the peel directly into the glass. The essential oils released from the fresh peel will intensify the aroma and give the Paloma a more complex citrus profile, adding a dimension that bottled grapefruit juice can't achieve.

ingredients.name: Sugar Syrup (Demerara syrup (1:1 sugar to water))

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: In a heat-safe mixing bowl, combine rum, coconut water, Velvet Falernum, pineapple juice, lime juice, and Demerara syrup

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium-low heat, stirring until it begins to bubble around the edges (do not boil)

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Add the hot milk to the mixing bowl and stir until the mixture begins to coagulate

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Let it sit for 15 minutes, then strain through a cheesecloth or coffee filter until clarified

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Ladle into cups over ice and garnish with a pineapple slice , maraschino cherry, or both

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Consider using a mix of both light and dark aged rum for an even more complex flavor profile. The light rum will uplift the citrus notes while the dark rum enhances the richness and body of the cocktail.

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: For an extra smooth texture, double strain the clarified mixture through a fine mesh sieve after the initial filtration. This will further eliminate any remaining fine particles and result in an exceptionally clear drink.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Begin by pouring the desired amount of absinthe into your glass of choice, setting the stage for your classic cocktail

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Next, place a cube of sugar on a slotted absinthe spoon, ensuring it rests securely across the top of the glass; this will add a subtle sweetness to the drink

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Then, gradually drip iced water over the sugar cube using an absinthe fountain, or improvise with a bottle of chilled mineral water by piercing a small hole in the cap, allowing the sugar to dissolve and mix into the absinthe

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Aim for a 1:1 ratio of water to absinthe, but feel free to adjust the amount of water if you're working with full-strength absinthe to achieve a more palatable dilution

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Continue this process until the absinthe becomes opaquely milky white, a transformation known as "louching", marking the perfect time to add ice

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Give the concoction a gentle stir to blend the ingredients and chill the drink, then prepare to serve your beautifully crafted absinthe cocktail

steps.name: Step: 7

steps.name: Step: 8

recipies.name: Spicy Mango Margarita
recipies.garnish: Lime wedge or habanero slice; rim with chili powder and coarse sea salt

ingredients.name: Mango Puree (Prepared with fresh mangos, lemon juice, lime juice, water, and habanero pepper)
Chilli peppers (Haberno chilli for garnish and puree)

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: To prepare the mango puree, peel and chop fresh mangos and place them in a blender along with freshly squeezed lemon and lime juice, water, and a chopped habanero pepper

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Blend until smooth, then refrigerate overnight to allow the flavors to meld

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: For the margarita, fill a shaker with ice and add tequila blanco, orange liqueur, agave nectar, and the prepared mango puree

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Shake well until chilled

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Rim a glass with a mixture of chili powder and coarse sea salt, fill with ice, and strain the margarita into the glass

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Top with a splash of seltzer water and garnish with a lime wedge or habanero slice

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: For the mango puree, ensure to use ripe mangos as they impart the most intense flavor and natural sweetness. If ripe mangos aren't available, consider roasting slightly under-ripe mangos to bring out their sugars and enhance the sweetness.

steps.name: Step: 8
steps.text: When making the chili and salt rim, try using smoked chili powder to add an element of depth and complexity, which complements the smokiness of tequila. It's a small tweak that will elevate the overall flavor profile.

steps.text: Use a high-quality dry gin with a botanical profile that complements the bitter ingredients. A gin with notes of orange peel and angelica root will harmonize beautifully with the Amaro and Fernet-Branca.

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Instead of using ordinary ice, consider using a large ice cube or sphere when stirring the cocktail. This will slow the dilution rate and allow you to control the chilling process more precisely, enhancing the balance of the rich and bitter flavors.

recipies.name: Picante de la Casa (Soho House Tonic)

ingredients.name: Chilli peppers (Adjust quantity for desired spiciness)

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Muddle chili slices in a shaker

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Add tequila, lime juice, agave syrup, and coriander leaves

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Shake with ice, then fine strain into an ice-filled rocks glass

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Garnish with a chili slice and coriander leaf

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Consider using a high-quality, aged Reposado tequila that has complex vanilla and caramel notes, as this will complement the spicy and citrus elements of the cocktail, providing a more sophisticated depth of flavor.

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Prior to muddling, slightly toast the chili slices using a small torch or by briefly toasting on a pan. This will enhance their smoky flavors and expand the cocktail's aromatic profile.

ingredients.name: Coffee liqueur (Mr. Black Cold Brew Coffee Liqueur)
Sugar Syrup (1:1 ratio of sugar to water)

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Shake vigorously, then strain into a Nick & Nora glass

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Garnish with three coffee beans for a classic finish

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Use freshly brewed espresso that has been chilled to enhance the rich coffee aroma and prevent dilution of flavors. Avoid using pre-brewed or cold store-bought espresso as it tends to lose its sharpness and aroma.

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Consider using a premium vodka, such as Ketel One, as it offers a smoother taste and complements the coffee and liqueur without overpowering them. Its refined qualities ensure a seamless blend with other ingredients.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Combine all ingredients, including the overripe banana, in a blender with a cup of pebble ice

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Blend until smooth

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Pour into a lowball glass and top with crushed ice

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Serve immediately for a refreshing treat

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Use an overripe banana as it enhances the sweetness and depth of flavor, providing a natural and velvety sweetness without needing extra sugar. Overripe bananas also blend more smoothly, giving the cocktail a creamy texture.

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: For a nuanced tropical flavor, lightly toast some unsweetened shredded coconut and sprinkle it on top of the cocktail just before serving. This adds a delightful aroma and a subtle crunchy texture that complements the smoothness of the drink.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Fill a large jug 3/4 full with ice

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Add the Campari, sweet vermouth, and prosecco

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Stir gently to combine

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Top up with soda water to taste

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Garnish with twists of orange peel and serve in glasses over ice

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Use high-quality prosecco or champagne to ensure a refined taste. A brut variety complements the sweetness of the vermouth perfectly.

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: For a more complex flavor, consider infusing the Campari with dried orange peel or a rosemary sprig for a few hours before mixing the cocktail.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: In a mixing glass, combine brewed coffee, bitters, and maple syrup

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Add bourbon and ice, then stir until well chilled

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Strain into a lowball glass over a large ice cube

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Garnish with an orange twist and a few coffee beans for an aromatic finish

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Use a high-quality, freshly brewed coffee, preferably a cold brew or espresso, to enhance the depth and richness of the coffee flavor. Cold brew coffee provides a smoother and fuller body, which pairs beautifully with bourbon.

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Consider infusing your bourbon with coffee beans for 24 hours before using it in the cocktail. This will impart a subtle, cohesive coffee aroma throughout the drink without overpowering the bourbon's character.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Add tequila, orange liqueur, Grand Marnier, white cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Cap the shaker and shake vigorously for at least 15 seconds

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Strain the liquid into a glass with fresh ice

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Garnish the glass with 4 cranberries and a sprig of rosemary

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Serve and enjoy!

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: To enhance the festive aroma, lightly torch the rosemary sprig before garnishing. This releases the essential oils and creates a delightful scent that complements the cocktail's flavors.

steps.name: Step: 8
steps.text: For a deeper flavor profile, consider infusing your simple syrup with a hint of cinnamon or star anise. This adds a subtle spiced note that pairs well with the cranberry and citrus elements.
